page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content:
Our study area is situated in { {North Lincolnshire,}north-east of the small market town of Caistor.The block extends from the west facing scarp of the chalk Wolds continuing east along the dip-slope which contains several dry valleys. This is a rural area; only five isolated settlements appear in the block. Forty-four per-cent of the working population are involved in jobs related to agriculture. Fifteen per-cent of the block is covered with forests, a part of the Earl of Yarborough's estate. The remaining part of the study area is under the plough but most farmers practise mixed farming eg. sheep on steeper slopes.
Population 43 Density 0.014/acre Highest point 141m. Lowest point 62m. Railways nil Roads 9.6km. Rivers nil Footpaths 0.35km.
